caption: The photograph displays a close-up view of what appears to be a natural setting with a small dead fish affixed to a sponge-like structure, and a bee resting on the fish. The setting is likely underwater or arranged to mimic an underwater scene. The fish hangs vertically and has dull eyes and a body that glistens slightly, suggesting it is wet. The sponge-like structure is orange and porous, having a texture like that of coral or some sponge species. Its shape is irregular, with loops and protruding parts. The backdrop is dark and nondescript, focusing the viewerâ€™s attention on the fish and sponge structure in the foreground. There are small particles visible in the air or water around these central elements, adding to the naturalistic quality of the scene. The overall composition and elements suggest an exploration of interaction between marine life and other natural elements, possibly highlighting ecological connections or dependencies.
title: Close-up of garbage and tiny dead fish which were washed ashore along Lake Charles.  Mercury content of the lake is high because of heavy concentration of industry nearby
